attributes.action: Reduced motor insurance for young drivers
attributes.additional_details:
Motor insurance for under-25s and first time drivers is seldom achieved under the four figure estimate, most usually in excess of £3000.
This encourages "fronting" and an increasing number of young drivers willing to accept the punishment for no insurance over paying the premium.
The government must assist in this matter; how can young drivers legally begin driving with the cost being so stupidly high?
